alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 11:55AM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring and is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Ottawa. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...A significant ice jam has formed on the Grand River near Robinson Township. Flooding is occuring at low-lying and flood-prone areas including Limberlost Lane and Van Lopik Avenue. The ice remains jammed up in this area, and additional shifting of the ice and thickening of the ice jam is possible this evening and overnight. This may lead to additional rising water and significant flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM EST, Ottawa county emergency management indicates that the ice jam remains near the Connor Bayou area this morning. Water levels will continue to fluctuate as the ice moves. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Ottawa County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
